title: If Pro Play Has Taught Me Anything About Being A Jungler
body:
It's never ever to do baron when the enemy jungler is around baron, if you have the lead just push for an inhib instead of risking losing baron. I am definitely tired of seeing people go for baron and getting out smited since there's always room for error. 

Don't baron just push on.

The thing is to even do that you need a nice lead, since the thing is designed as a raid boss that takes 3-5 people to kill properly and all of you are taking some damage.  100-400 missing health can mean a lot when we're talking about a full damage assassin getting in range and starting a duel.  Baron is one of the riskiest things in the game due to its design, you pretty much have to kill jungler(or zone em), inhib, or have a good lead for it to be of use to you.

Three good times to do it.
1. The jungler is dead
2. The enemy team has been aced
3. The enemy can't push out quickly enough to reach baron

Any other time it is always a high risk and often you could be better off doing something else.

> The enemy can't push out quickly enough to reach baron

tbh i find it rly hard to tell. There was one game where I saw my midlaner {{champion:4}} split push botlane, only to get 3 manned and get killed. The 2 other enemies were a support and a dead player who got caught out 20 seconds ago or so.
I immediately called for baron but the 3 people + support somehow still arrived at the scene before my team could secure baron and stopped us.

You have to judge quite a few things to make sure it's the right move. For that option the most common time you'd see it is with inhibs down and the enemy has to defend base. The most common way to make it work in higher elo is to get people to start slow pushing a wave or too. Then as the wave starts to stack you call for the baron or objective. Someone will HAVE to get the wave or they will lose their towers and worse inhib

I said bonus true damage- it's 1000 more damage relative to if he'd used it on a champion.

Baron plays require deep wards to spot the enemy coming, it requires your jungler to have smite, it requires their jungler to be dead, it requires your team to know they need to peel off the Baron when it gets low and zone the enemy away from the steal. It requires a tank, and it requires some good objective DPS on your team and present.

The potential for any of that to go wrong in solo Q is massive. Many junglers, and most non-junglers, don't know how to set up an objective play properly. 

Also, it's really, really important for your team to realize it's actually easier for the aggressing (stealing) jungler to land a smite, than it is for the defending jungler. If you are taking Baron, and you have Quinn/Draven on your team, and they start trying to burst down the baron when it's low HP trying to help you secure - they are actually making the HP drop as erratically as possible - this makes it harder for their jungler to secure the smite. It also makes it easier for the enemy (stealing) jungler to land their smite. The best thing for your team to do when taking Baron is NOT to try to burst it down when it's low, it's to zone the enemy team off and let the jungler land the objective solo, smoothly: smooth is better than fast (erratic).
